TopicTitle: Is it possible to crash into the Sun?

Articles.Content: I can\'t make it there myself I can get into orbit around the sun but I don\'t ever have enough fuel to make it to the surface. Is it even possible?
No, the sun has no 'surface'. You would just go through it.
The sun is a point source gravity well. Once you break kerbin\'s gravity well you won\'t need any more fuel, you\'ll fall towards the sun. Just crank the warp to 10,000x and wait.
Be prepared for this when you go through it though.

The sun is just a background with unlimited light.

Thus, if you were to crash into it you would most likely go to a white screen.

The sun doesn\'t have a surface, so you can simply go through it.

However, the extremely high gravity near the centre of the sun is too much for the physics engine to handle properly-I was once spat out at just over the speed of light, and one guy managed to break it completely and reach infinite speed.

I found this out after managing to get myself into an extremely elliptical orbit around the Sun... I\'ll take a screenshot next time I do it, but you get to a white screen, and then all of a sudden, it turns black; at that point you have passed 'through' where the surface of the Sun ought to be -- turn the camera around, and the screen becomes white again pretty quickly.

Oh, and as somebody else mentioned, insane speed as well xD
